request.description:
This API is used to logging into the application.

We use JWT login system. An ID and a password is sent to the server which returns an access token and a refresh token.

The access token can be used to make further API calls using header

`Authorisation: Bearer`

The access token automatically expires in 5 minutes. You need to use the refresh token to retrieve another access token for subsequent APIs

Refer to Refresh Token API

**Note**

In this request, upon successful response, The access token and the refresh token are added to the environment variables so there is no need to copy and use them in the other APIs. Just call the Login API and you are ready to use the other APIs. The fresh token is used automatically.

response.name: Login Invalid Credentials

request.description:
This API is used to retrieve a new Access Token

The access token received in the Login API expires in 5 mins. However, the refresh token is valid for 24 hours and can be used to retrieve a new access token

A Refresh Token can only be used once. The refresh token API also returns a new refresh token that can be used next time to retrieve the access token

**Note**

In this request, upon successful response, The access token and the refresh token are added to the environment variables so there is no need to copy and use them in the other APIs. The fresh ones are used automatically.

Just call the Refresh Token API and you are ready to call it again with the new refresh token that has been automatically set in the environment variable.

This API creates an alert for the user.

Required fields:

**coin_id:** This can be one of the allowed ticker symbols. The following are currently supported:

- btc
- eth
- usdt
- bnb
- xrp
- ada
- doge
    

**alert_price:** The price at which alert needs to be triggered

query.description: Page number with respect to paginated response
Status of alert. Accepted Values: created, triggered, deleted

request.description:
This API is used to list Alerts for a particular user.

The API is paginated. You can use `page` query param to request for a specific page number

The API also supports filtering based on alert status using query param `alert_status` currenlty accepted values are:

- created
- triggered
- deleted

response.name: List Alerts - List All Alerts

query.description: page number with respect to paginated response

request.description:
This API is used to retrieve an alert.

The ID of the alert to be deleted is passed in URL

`/alerts/{alert_id}`

This API is used to delete an alert.

The ID of the alert to be deleted is passed in URL

`/alerts/{alert_id}`
